text:
How To Keep Spiders Out Of Your Home With This Natural Repellent Subscribe to Reshareworthy! It's FREE and always will be! 
No one likes spiders in the home, but we’re often told they are important for keeping the insect population in check. That’s why when I was young and found any spider in the home, my mom always told me not to kill it. The irony was she was terrified of them, so I’d have to find a way to pick it up and throw it out without harming it. Our lives would have been so much easier had we known this handy solution. 
You can make your own natural spider repellent to spray around the home that will repel them naturally without killing them and without using dangerous chemicals. 
There are several smells that spiders really don’t like. Peppermint, citrus/oranges, and vinegar are among them. 
To make the spider deterrent, mix peppermint essential oil in water. You will also want to add a surfactant (like a dishwasher liquid) to keep the watery mixture from beading when sprayed. 
If you don’t like the way mint smells, you can try using orange or lavender essential oils or vinegar instead.
